title: Harriet Tubman Civil War - Later Development

content.description:
“My claim against the U.S. is for three years services as [a] Nurse and cook in hospitals, and as commander of Several Men (Eight or Nine) as scouts [beginning in 1863] during the late war of the Rebellion, under directions and orders of Edwin M. Stanton, Secretary of War, and of several Generals.
“I claim for my services above named the sum of Eighteen hundred dollars.”
Harriet Tubman, formerly enslaved abolitionist activist, petition to the United States government for a pension, submitted in 1898
content.question: Most African Americans in the United States military served in segregated units until the

choices.label: deployment of troops to the Philippines during the Spanish-American War
signing of the Treaty of Versailles after the First World War
passage of isolationist laws during the Great Depression
enactment of military reforms after the Second World War

content.answer: enactment of military reforms after the Second World War

topic.text: 8.6: Early Steps in the Civil Rights Movement (1940s and 1950s)

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
